gx.bases Module¶

The Graphics View Framework of PyQt relies on the following three main objects:

  • QGraphicsItem : Represents a 2D graphical object. Can be drawn using primitives from QPainter or also can load images.
  • QGraphicsScene : Container for QGraphicsItem objects, managing all the itens positions, rectangles and stacking order.
  • QGraphicsView : A QWidget specialized on draw contents from some QGraphicsScene.

This module provides re-implementations for each one of those objects, by setting up some attributes project-specific and also adding some new funtionality.

Convention: Classes beginning with Gx mean that they are somehow related to the Graphics View Framework or represents subclasses of QGraphicsItem, i.e., can be inserted on the scene.

GxView class¶

class visuino.gx.bases.GxView(scene=None, parent=None, opengl=False, wheel_zoom=False)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QGraphicsView

Holds optimization flags for the project in general and also offers wheel zooming.

Variables:
  • wheel_zoom – bool <False>. Enable/disable the wheel zooming feature.
  • _zoom_level – int <0>. Keeps track of how many scalings have occured.
__init__(self, scene=None, parent=None, opengl=False, wheel_zoom=False)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • scene – QGraphicsScene <None>. QGraphicsView.__init__().
  • parent – QWidget <None>. QGraphicsView.__init__().
  • opengl – bool <False>. Enables use of Open GL rendering through PyQt4.QtOpenGL.QGLWidget.
  • wheel_zoom – bool <False>. Enables wheel zooming functionality.
wheelEvent(self, event)[source]¶

QGraphicsView.wheelEvent(QWheelEvent) -> NoneType

Provides the wheel zooming functionality by calling QGraphicsView.scale() according to the amount of scrolling.

GxSceneBlocks class¶

class visuino.gx.bases.GxSceneBlocks(parent=None, background_grid=True)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QGraphicsScene

Besides adding the “bring to front” functionality (along with “click to front”), this class also holds sets of paths used to detect collision between notches (see visuino.gx.connections).

Variables:
  • background_grid – bool <True>. Enables the drawing of a grid on the background layer of the scene.
  • click_to_front – bool <True>. Enables the “click to front” feature, on which the clicked item always is brought to the front of the scene.
  • vf_male_colli_paths – set of visuino.gx.connections.GxColliPath. Hold paths for detecting collision of moving female -> male VF notches.
  • vf_female_colli_paths – set of visuino.gx.connections.GxColliPath. Hold paths for detecting collision of moving male -> female VF notches.
  • io_female_colli_paths – set of visuino.gx.connections.GxColliPath. Hold paths for detecting collision of moving male -> female IO notches.
  • _top_item – QGraphicsItem <None>. Holds the last item brought to the front. Therefore, changes with self.bringToFront().
  • _top_z – float <None>. zValue of the top-most item on the scene. Changes with self.bringToFront().
Z_INCREMENT = 1e-10¶

Increment on zValue for use on self.bringToFront()

__init__(self, parent=None, background_grid=True)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • parent – QObject. QGraphicsScene.__init__()
  • background_grid – bool. Enables drawing of a grid on the background layer of the scene.
getTopItem(self)[source]¶
Returns:QGraphicsItem - The top-most item on the scene.
bringToFront(self, item)[source]¶

Make the given item the top-most on the scene by setting properly a new zValue (if necessary).

Parameters:item – QGraphicsItem.
drawBackground(self, painter, rect)[source]¶

QGraphicsScene.drawBrackground(QPainter, QRectF) -> NoneType

If self.background_grid flag is True, then draws a series of vertical and horizontal paralell lines to form a squared grid.

mousePressEvent(self, event)[source]¶

QGraphicsScene.mousePressEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) -> NoneType

Appends the “click to front” functionality.

GxBlock class¶

class visuino.gx.bases.GxBlock(scene, parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QGraphicsItem

Abstract base class that implements basic attributes and functionality for any graphical block to be inserted on GxSceneBlocks.

The virtual method paint() of QGraphicsItem base class must be re-implemented, also with the three following ones:

  • getBorderWidth();
  • updateMetrics();
  • cloneMe();

No need to re-implement QGraphicsItem.boundingRect().

Variables:
  • _width – number <200>. Width of the bounding rectangle.
  • _height – number <100>. Height of the bounding rectangle.
  • _border_path – QPainterPath. Path that defines the shape of this item. The default path is a rect that contains its bounding rectangle.
  • _default_block_cursor – QCursor <Qt.OpenHandCursor>. Cursor used when the block is not colliding with the palette.
  • _palette_colliding – bool. Flag to indicate palette collision. See ``self.checksPaletteCollide().
  • palette_blocks – visuino.gx.palette.GxPalette <None>. Used to detecting collision with the palette. Should be set only by the palette itself. See self.checksPaletteCollide().
  • new_block – bool. Tells if this block has just been instantiated by the palette. See self.checksPaletteCollide(). Should be set only by the palette itself.
__init__(self, scene, parent=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • scene – GxSceneBlocks. By convention, in this project all blocks are inserted on the scene right here, on instantiation.
  • parent – GxBlock.
_checkPaletteCollide(self)[source]¶

Check if it is colliding with the palette and respond properly by updating the cursor shape. Designed to be called on the mouse move event of this item.

boundingRect(self)[source]¶

QGraphicsItem.boundingRect() -> QRectF

Returns:QRectF - retangle with dimensions (self._width, self._height).
shape(self)[source]¶
Returns:QPainterPath - Item delimiting shape.
updateMetrics(self)[source]¶

TO BE RE-IMPLEMENTED

The purpose of this method should be to update the block dimentions and also its border path according to its contents.

Example:

def updateMetrics(self):
    self.prepareGeometryChange()

    self._width, self._height = 200, 100

    path = QPainterPath()
    path.addRect(self.boundingRect())
    self._border_path = path

    self.update(self.boundingRect())
cloneMe(self, scene)[source]¶

TO BE RE-IMPLEMENTED

Should return an instance of itself, with the very same attribute values. This method is used mainly visuino.gx.palette.GxPalette to instantiate new blocks on the given scene.

Parameters:scene – GxSceneBlocks.
Returns:GxBlock subclass.
getBorderWidth(self)[source]¶

TO BE RE-IMPLEMENTED

Should return the correct border width value for this kind of block. See visuino.settings.

getWidth(self)[source]¶
Returns:number. Width of its path bounding rectangle.
getHeight(self)[source]¶
Returns:number. Height of its path bounding rectangle.
getTopParentItem(self)[source]¶
Returns:GxBlock - The top-most parent item (if no parent, then return self).
removeFromScene(self)[source]¶

This method should be used to remove a GxBlock from the scene. First, it calls removeFromScene on all its childs, because some of them might be visuino.gx.connections.GxColliPath, which has its on removeFromScene() special behavior.

mouseMoveEvent(self, event)[source]¶

QGraphicsItem.mouseMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) -> NoneType

Calls self._checkPaletteCollide().

mouseReleaseEvent(self, event)[source]¶

QGraphicsItem.mouseReleaseEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) -> NoneType

If it is colliding with the palette, then remove itself from the scene.
